document_title: Ovarian cancer: Causes, signs and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Usually, the initial symptoms of ovarian cancer are often unclear, so they are easily confused with symptoms of many other common diseases. Diagnosis in the early stages is quite difficult, even using a Pap smear test sometimes cannot detect it.
Therefore, it is recommended that women have regular gynecological examinations to be examined and accurately diagnosed by doctors as soon as the following unusual and persistent changes occur: (2)
Feeling bloated or having pelvic pain;; Loss of appetite;; Unexplained weight loss;; Gastrointestinal disorders such as nausea, vomiting, constipation;; Heartburn;; Back-ache;; Frequent urination;; Often tired and irritable;; Abnormal menstrual cycle, abnormal post-menopausal vaginal bleeding;; Burning pain during sex.
Patients may experience persistent lower abdominal pain
It should be noted that the above symptoms can also be caused by other diseases. Patients need to immediately go to a medical facility for examination, combined with performing many other paraclinical tests to accurately determine the cause of strange and persistent symptoms, and have treatment interventions. promptly and prevent dangerous complications of the disease.
